original: Ödlund, Helge Olof, civilingenjör, fd. yrkesinspektör, skyddsinspektör, Linköping, f. 16/5/83 i Njurunda, Väster-norrl. 1., av landsfiskal O. P. Ö. o. Hilma Schöblom. G. 13 m. Anna Holmberg. Barn: Erik f. 14, d. 16, Gunborg Elisabet 17, Kerstin 22. — Tekn. elemisk. i Norrköp. 00-03, kompl. f. stud:ex. 05, avgiex. fr. KTH (M) 08. Ing. v. Sthlm,s stads gasverk ()8-13, yrkesinsp: as sist. i Härnöisand 14-17, i Gbg 1(7-23, förste byråing. i soc:styr. 23-26, yrkesinsp. i tredje distr. i Lin-köp. 26-46. Skyddsinsp. h. Holmens Bruks o. Fabr. A-B f. dess samtl. fabr. fr. 46. Deleg. f. sv. staten v. soc. veckan i Helsingfors 28. Led. av dir. f. centrallas. i Linköp. Studires. m. statsunderst. t. Tyskl. 14, 26, Norge 19. Skr.: Jämför, härdn:- o. glödgn :prov m. anv. av gas, koks o. kol (11), An-läggn. f. bortsugn. av skadl. gaser (18), Arbetsskyddsanordn. in. fiskkonserv-ind. (19), Om mätlängd. f. mätn. av brottförlängn. v. dragprov (25), Yrkesinsp. sträv. o. ind. prod :kostn. (26), Natronlut o. sprickbildn. i ångpanme-plåt (26), Vad är yrkesinsp. — vilken dess uppgift? (29) m. fl. RVO 36.
translated: Ödlund, Helge Olof, civil engineer, former occupational inspector, safety inspector, Linköping, born on May 16, 1883 in Njurunda, West Norrland, the first child of district bailiff O. P. Ö. and Hilma Schöblom. Married to Anna Holmberg since 1913. Children: Erik, born in 1914, died in 1916, Gunborg Elisabet, born in 1917, Kerstin, born in 1922. Technical elementary school in Norrköping from 1900-1903. Completed secondary school education in 1905. Graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (Mechanical Engineering) in 1908. Engineer at Stockholm's city gas works from 1908-1913, occupational inspector in Härnösand from 1914-1917, in Gothenburg from 1917-1923. First bureau engineer in the social board from 1923-1926. Occupational inspector in the third district of Linköping from 1926-1946. Safety inspector at Holmens Bruks and Fabr. A-B for all of its factories from 1946. Delegate for the Swedish state at the Social Week in Helsinki in 1928. Member of the board of the central office in Linköping. Study grants with government support for Germany in 1914 and 1926, and for Norway in 1919. Writings: Comparative, hardening and annealing tests using gas, coke and coal (1911), Installation for removing harmful gases (1918), Occupational safety measures in the fish canning industry (1919), On the measurement of elongation in tensile tests (1925), Efforts and industrial production costs in occupational inspection (1926), Caustic soda and cracking of steam boiler plates (1926), What is occupational inspection - what is its purpose? (1929), and several others. Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa in 1936.
